comment.brief: If a size parameter is not availble it will reutrn 0, via Size, X, Y
comment.full:
If a size parameter is not availble it will reutrn 0, via Size, X, Y

`struct` was chosen here over `class` for performance reasons. A lot of these objects are
created for node in the tree and in performance testing the structs were simply performing
a lot better.

comment.brief: Do box model constraining on this with the provided constraints.
comment.full: Do box model constraining on this with the provided constraints.

comment.brief: Create an exact copy of this instance.
comment.full: Create an exact copy of this instance.

comment.brief: Create a copy of this instance that is suitable for used in layout derivation.
comment.full:
Create a copy of this instance that is suitable for used in layout derivation.

This clears the relative settings on the layout.

comment.brief: Apply ordered constraints of this LayoutParams to the point.
comment.full: Apply ordered constraints of this LayoutParams to the point.

comment.brief: For removing border areas like Margin and Padding
comment.full: For removing border areas like Margin and Padding

comment.brief: Retains or discards the X/Y information.
comment.full:
Retains or discards the X/Y information.

Be careful when using this, it is typically used in combination with RetainMaxXY (or RetainAxesXY in combination), or with a ConstrainMax. The layout must consider how it affects not just the X/Y values, but also the Min/Max XY values.
